I've been renting asian horror films lately and they just cream anything hollywood can put out.
 
 Just some I thought were great (a couple have been made into inferior US versions).
 
 1. Ju-On (Japan)
 2. Audition (Japan)
 3. Cure (Japan)
 4. Dark Water (Japan)
 5. Old Boy (S. Korea)
 
 
 I'm going to start seeking more of these out.
 
 Can anyone recommend some for me?

I saw that one of the other DVDs as a trailer.
 
 I guess I'll rent that one next.
 
 Thanks.

Ugh, I just rented "Infection" and it sucked!
 It was low budget and the acting was WAY over the top.
 I dunno, maybe it's good in a campy sort of way.
 
 It reminded me of "Tomei" and it's many progressively crappier sequels.
 
 I can't find "Hypnosis" for now, but I rented "The Eye". ooooo creepy.....

I haven't seen any of the others you mentioned so I'll just comment on this one.
 I thought Dark Water...well...stunk. It didn't feel at all well connected. It just wasn't put together well I don't think.

Some of them give me that impression too.
 I think it's the Japanese style of filming.
 It goes very quickly.
 
 Also, when I watch some movies with subtitles that are very literal, I sometimes can't make out what's going on. If I watch it again with dubbing, it detracts from the action (to me), but sometimes they help the story make more sense.
 
 And, these movies are made for Asian audiences and the cultural differences sometimes make the story, or a scene here or there, a little confusing. 
 
 I think the way death and spirits are dealt with in asian cultures can sometimes make a scene or a plot point confusing to a Western audience.
 
 The Eye is from Hong Kong I think, so it may be more palatable for most westerners. Even some of the words they use are english, mixed in with the cantonese.

title: 4Forums.com Political Debates and Polls -  Asian Horror/Suspense Films Cream Hollywood
